parameters.definition: Number of packages a camel can carry
Number of packages a horse can carry
Units of food required by a camel
Units of food required by a horse
Minimum number of packages to be delivered

description: A company in the middle east delivers their packages to customers on camels and horses. A camel can carry \param{CamelCapacity} packages while a horse can carry \param{HorseCapacity} packages. A camel requires \param{CamelFood} units of food while a horse requires \param{HorseFood} units of food. The company needs to deliver at least \param{MinPackages} packages and they have \param{TotalFood} units of food available. Since horses are not as suited for the hot climate, the number of horses cannot exceed the number of camels. How many of each animal should be used to minimize the total number of animals?
